topic.title: US Gov Angry at RT for Exposing Surveillance State, Lack of Democracy, and Wall Street Greed
topic.body:
From a report by the Director of National Intelligence 2017 https://www.dni.gov/files/documents/ICA_2017_01.pdf
NullFolder hash bf551ccb3a5ca8d81d1ed2980d152cd3a478dba5
Parts of pages 6-8 that I found to be most important:

From August to November 2012, RT ran numerous reports on alleged US election fraud and voting machine vulnerabilities, contending that US election results cannot be trusted and do not reflect the popular will.

In an effort to highlight the alleged "lack of democracy" in the United States, RT broadcast, hosted, and advertised third-party candidate debates and ran reporting supportive of the political agenda of these candidates. The RT hosts asserted that the US two-party system does not represent the views of at least one-third of the population and is a "sham."

RT aired a documentary about the Occupy Wall Street movement on 1, 2, and 4 November. RT framed the movement as a fight against "the ruling class" and described the current US political system as corrupt and dominated by corporations. RT advertising for the documentary featured Occupy movement calls to "take back" the government. The documentary claimed that the US system cannot be changed democratically, but only through "revolution."

RT created a Facebook app to connect Occupy Wall Street protesters via social media. In addition, RT featured its own hosts in Occupy rallies ("Minaev Live," 10 April; RT, 2, 12 June).

RT's reports often characterize the United States as a "surveillance state" and allege widespread infringements of civil liberties, police brutality, and drone use (RT, 24, 28 October, 1-10 November).

RT has also focused on criticism of the US
economic system, US currency policy, alleged
Wall Street greed, and the US national debt. Some of RT's hosts have compared the United States to Imperial Rome and have predicted that government corruption and "corporate greed" will lead to US financial collapse (RT, 31 October, 4 November).

RT runs anti-fracking programming, highlighting environmental issues and the impacts on public health. This is likely reflective of the Russian Government's concern about the impact of fracking and US natural gas production on the global energy market and the potential challenges to Gazprom's profitability (5 October).

RT is a leading media voice opposing Western intervention in the Syrian conflict and blaming the West for waging "information wars" against the Syrian Government (RT, 10 October-9 November).

In an earlier example of RT's messaging in
support of the Russian Government, during the Georgia-Russia military conflict the channel accused Georgians of killing civilians and organizing a genocide of the Ossetian people. According to Simonyan, when "the Ministry of Defense was at war with Georgia," RT was "waging an information war against the entire Western world" (Kommersant, 11 July).

Maybe US corperate media would run more stories like these if they weren't owned/influenced. RT shows its obvious Russian bias in whitewashing Russia's involventment in Syria and Georgia.

topic.title: ZeroNet Privacy
topic.body: What prevents intellegence agencies from scraping data from this if all the data is public?

1522814572_1CRjFXJs62yigvAahAzVw1nAxPX8K.body: Bernie is for UBI https://medium.com/basic-income/on-the-record-bernie-sanders-on-basic-income-de9162fb3b5c and whats wrong with free college?

1523080841_1467X2hmPQP5gAKnh9uhQX6M1DWCH.body: Im not promoting them I just find the reason the US government is mad at them is strange

IK RT is propaganda from Russia but its interesting how they try to undermine the US gov by exposing real issues about America. Some may be exadgerated. Getting news from USA about USA hasn't been honest.

> [steelmemes](#comment_1_1N2JLPM7vMtsQkPZiatLHyU6shFKP7aZWg): Go back to bed Pelosi, you're fucking drunk.
 brc256 said about Russia was true. I'm not promition RT tho.

1529023524_16jxbpwWm7DbyFCRhQ4FNirjuLsen.body: You can install Tor using brew

> [wildrunning](#comment_8_16jxbpwWm7DbyFCRhQ4FNirjuLsenv26Lk): Thanks @KM199. Is it possible to set exit points and include exclude countries with the Brew loaded Tor?

You could check your ip and if you want a different one, you can have tor make a new circuit. I don't think automating that would be that hard. Additionally you might want to let circuits live for longer than the default 10 mins.
